definition:
1. Having the power of dissolving; dissolving; as, a solvent fluid. "the solvent body." Boyle. 2. Able or sufficient to pay all just debts; as, a solvent merchant; the estate is solvent.

A substance (usually liquid) suitable for, or employed in, solution, or in dissolving something; as, water is the appropriate solvent of most salts, alcohol of resins, ether of fats, and mercury or acids of metal, etc. 2. That which resolves; as, a solvent of mystery.
